alert.note: Alert for Kanabec (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:54PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Kanabec County through 700 PM CDT... At 553 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles south of McGrath, or 13 miles northwest of Hinckley, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail and torrential rainfall with minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Kanabec County, including the following locations... Snake River State Forest, Knife Lake and Warman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for east central Minnesota.
